meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Libby Speaks on Tape, But May Not in Court The jurors deciding the perjury case against I. Lewis Libby Jr. listened to his voice on audiotape for hours. But beyond the courtroom, his lawyers were exploring whether to keep him off the witness stand, which would ensure that the jurors never hear his voice in person.
PAGE A14

Home of the Proper Cocktail London is becoming known as a place to find sophisticated cocktails -- like the Jasmine Pearl at the Dorchester Hotel -- coming a long way from the days when fruit in a glass was considered exotic.
DINING, PAGE F1

Breast Cancer Test Approved The Food and Drug Administration approved a genetic test that tries to predict whether a woman with breast cancer will have a relapse, a step toward an era of personalized medical treatments.
PAGE A13

China and Climate Change China said that wealthier countries must take the lead in curbing greenhouse gas emissions and refused to say whether it would agree to emissions limits that might hamper its economy.
PAGE A9

Apple's View of Music Piracy Apple's chief, Steven P. Jobs, said record companies should allow songs to be sold online without anticopying software, in part because the technology does not stop piracy.
PAGE C1
State Senate Seat to Democrat Unofficial returns showed Craig M. Johnson, the Democratic candidate, capturing a traditionally Republican State Senate seat in a special election on Long Island.
PAGE B1

Libby Speaks on Tape, But May Not in Court The jurors deciding the perjury case against I. Lewis Libby Jr. listened to his voice on audiotape for hours. But beyond the courtroom, his lawyers were exploring whether to keep him off the witness stand, which would ensure that the jurors never hear his voice in person.
PAGE A14

Home of the Proper Cocktail London is becoming known as a place to find sophisticated cocktails -- like the Jasmine Pearl at the Dorchester Hotel -- coming a long way from the days when fruit in a glass was considered exotic.
DINING, PAGE F1

Breast Cancer Test Approved The Food and Drug Administration approved a genetic test that tries to predict whether a woman with breast cancer will have a relapse, a step toward an era of personalized medical treatments.
PAGE A13

China and Climate Change China said that wealthier countries must take the lead in curbing greenhouse gas emissions and refused to say whether it would agree to emissions limits that might hamper its economy.
PAGE A9

Apple's View of Music Piracy Apple's chief, Steven P. Jobs, said record companies should allow songs to be sold online without anticopying software, in part because the technology does not stop piracy.
PAGE C1
State Senate Seat to Democrat Unofficial returns showed Craig M. Johnson, the Democratic candidate, capturing a traditionally Republican State Senate seat in a special election on Long Island.
PAGE B1
